channel.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:7, topic:407243”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=508528.msg3692031#msg3692031 date=1312179262]

public static void main(final String[] args) {
    final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.println("Age: ");
    final int age = scanner.nextInt();
    System.out.println((age >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement.");
}

[/quote]

    public static void main(final String[] args) 
    {
	    final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
	    System.out.println("Age: ");
	    System.out.println((scanner.nextInt() >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement.");
	}

L0ol[/quote]

I think Zyle’s version is better as it allows their age to be used elsewhere (eg the user’s profile page) without the user entering it again.

Read full topic
item.source: My basic dating site register (just started coding)

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

vortex:

Do you know what print() does?

You win xD
Found it in “The Java Tutorials” and it seems like it would look much better, and it actually takes up two less characters of code (if that could honestly matter). >.>

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)

item.description:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:407243”][quote author=vortex link=topic=508528.msg3692581#msg3692581 date=1312225123]

public static void main(final String[] args) { System.out.print("Age: "); System.out.println(((new Scanner(System.in)).nextInt() >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement."); }
[/quote]

public static void main(final String[] args) { System.out.println("Age: "); System.out.println(((new Scanner(System.in)).nextInt() >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement."); }
Win - Notice the "Age: " println fail on yours <3[/quote]Do you know what print() does?

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

CoonHunter:

So this is my question. Why are you programming java components for a dating site? Wouldn’t this be better done in PHP so that they can come on from any platform?

I don’t think he means it to be a dating site. I believe this was more of an “Age verification” type program.

Read full topic

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:13, topic:407243”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=508528.msg3692044#msg3692044 date=1312180303]

public static void main(final String[] args) {
    final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.println("Age: ");
    final int age = scanner.nextInt();
    System.out.println((age >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement.");
}
    public static void main(final String[] args) 
    {
	    final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
	    System.out.println("Age: ");
	    System.out.println((scanner.nextInt() >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement.");
	}

L0ol
[/quote] public static void main(final String[] args) { System.out.print("Age: "); System.out.println(((new Scanner(System.in)).nextInt() >= 18) ? "Welcome." : "You do no meet the age requirement."); }[/quote]

That’s just verbose.

item.title: My basic dating site register (just started coding)
item.dc:creator: @theowned theowned
item.description:
@theowned wrote:

i just started coding and i made a basic dating site reister
you need an age of 18 ;D

import java.util.Scanner;

public class Helloworld
{
public static void main( String[] args ){
Scanner bucky = new Scanner (System.in);
int age;
System.out.println(“how old are you?”);
age = bucky.nextInt();
if (age > 18){
System.out.println(“welcome, you can enter”);
}else{
System.out.println(“you are too young too enter”);
}

}

}

Read full topic
